thread.title: Preet Bharara’s probes likely to continue after his exit - Wall Street Journal
thread.title_full: Preet Bharara’s probes likely to continue after his exit - Wall Street Journal

title: Preet Bharara’s probes likely to continue after his exit - Wall Street Journal
text:
Preet Bharara’s Probes Likely to Continue After His Exit Long-term direction of the Manhattan   is unclear By @peterwsj Updated March 12, 2017 7:54 p.m. ET 
The sudden departure of the top U.S. prosecutor in Manhattan raises uncertainty about the federal government’s approach to trying financial crimes and global terrorism cases, even as it isn’t likely to change the course of several high-profile investigations. 
Preet Bharara was fired as Manhattan U.S. attorney on Saturday, a day after the Justice Department asked the 46 remaining U.S. attorneys appointed by ex-President Barack Obama to step down. While it isn’t unusual for a new administration to fire holdover U.S.... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
